description: Step-by-step guide on how to create jobs on Mat3ra platform.
title: Mat3ra Onboarding: How to create jobs?

youTubeCaptions.text: How to get started with creating and running jobs in matera platform?
Creating job involves three steps.
Specify the material system, such as crystal structure, lattice constants and atomic positions.
Specify the workflow steps. <break time='0.25'/> Whether we are going to run a bandstructure calculation
Or a molecular dynamics calculation or something else?
Finally, depending on the system size, desired accuracy, and available resources, we can specify the compute parameters.
Such as the required number of nodes, the number of processors per node.
So, how do we specify the material system?
There are a few different options in matera platform.
We can upload structure files such as cif or vasp poscar formatted files from our local computer.
We can search in the materials bank. Currently there are over ten thousand structures contributed by matera user community.
Alternatively, <break time='0.25'/> We can import structure from third-party sources such as materials project.
If you still cannot find your structure, click the create button and design your material from scratch using materials designer.
Specify the lattice type, lattice constants, atomic positions, you have everything needed to generate any arbitrary structure.
Next, <break time='0.25'/>how do we specify workflow steps?
We can search in the workflow bank or create from scratch.
We can find most common workflows in matera workflow bank.
If required, we can always create workflows from scratch.
Specify if you need sub-workflow. Add units and flavors as required.
Once you have material and workflow in hand, navigate to job designer.
Click create new job. We can organize our jobs under an existing project or create new project.
Select a material or multiple materials as needed.
Select workflow and adjust any important parameters.
Navigate to compute tab and select cluster, queue type, number of nodes and number of processors per node.
Save and exit job designer.
Now our job creation is complete and ready to submit the job for execution.
Now visit platform dot matera dot com and try yourself. Thank you for watching this tutorial and using our platform.
